meanings.definition: A row of shrubs or trees forming a boundary or fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted a hedgerow along the edge of his property to mark the boundary clearly.
meanings.sent2: The birds nested in the hedgerow, finding shelter and safety among the branches.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the hedgerow as a secret passage to sneak into the garden.
meanings.sent4: The hedgerow stood tall and proud, like a natural fortress protecting the field.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the shadows of the hedgerow stretched long across the meadow.

meanings.definition: A boundary formed by a row of shrubs or trees.
meanings.sent1: The old stone wall crumbled, but the hedgerow remained as a sturdy boundary.
meanings.sent2: The hedgerow provided a natural barrier between the two neighboring properties.
meanings.sent3: The playful children pretended the hedgerow was a magical wall protecting their kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight danced on the leaves of the hedgerow, creating a mystical border.
meanings.sent5: The hedgerow whispered secrets to the wind, guarding the hidden treasures within.
